title: Hillary Clinton claims that Edward Snowden had protection for whistleblowers and didn't use them.
text: The decision of Edward Snowden to disclose the existence of large national security databases on American e-mail and telephone data remains a turning point for inter-American debate. Some people pay tribute to Snowden as a hero. For others, Snowden is a traitor. The United States Government accused Snowden, an employee of a State security contractor, of violating the espionage law. He had found asylum in Russia but wished to return home. In the first democratic debate on 13 October, the director of the CNN network pressured the candidates to present their point of view on Snowden.
